quotes.quote: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
As iron sharpens iron, so one man sharpens another.
I have legs of iron, but to tell you the truth, they're starting to rust and buckle a bit.
Iron rusts from disuse; water loses its purity from stagnation... even so does inaction sap the vigor of the mind.
As iron is eaten away by rust, so the envious are consumed by their own passion.
Everything has its limit - iron ore cannot be educated into gold.
The good Lord made us all out of iron. Then he turns up the heat to forge some of us into steel.
No man can feel the iron which enters another man's soul.
Man is harder than iron, stronger than stone and more fragile than a rose.
A teacher who is attempting to teach without inspiring the pupil with a desire to learn is hammering on cold iron.
Stupidity is an attempt to iron out all differences, and not to use or value them creatively.
Idleness is to the human mind like rust to iron
Money changes all the iron rules into rubber bands.
Theory attracts practice as the magnet attracts iron.
Adolescence is about digging out the iron inside irony
